title: new pc
content:

its a
p4 3GHz
512mb ram
128mb video
dvd reader
cdrw burner
160gb hard disk
price 700 euro

content:

Now the most obvious question; that determines whether your computer is usable or just a complete junk:
"Does Commander Keen work?"You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: new pc
content: [quote]Quote:[hr]You should be able to run Keen with Music in DOSbox[hr][/quote]Or failing that, you could [url=http://search.ebay.com.au/vibra_Computers-IT]grab a cheap sound card off eBay[/url] - IIRC the old Creative Vibra sound cards were PCI and SB16 compatible, which will give you sound in all DOS games (assuming you run them in native DOS.)

title: Re: new pc
content: Which he's not going to, because it's an XP. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

title: Re: new pc
content:
What's wrong with that? Ever since they got rid of DOS after Win98, I've always dual-booted DOS and Win2K, or DOS and XP. That way if I wanted to play games I just restarted XP and booted into DOS instead. I even dual booted DOS and Linux until I got an old PC just for DOS games...

IIRC it's even automatic, provided you have a working DOS partition when you install XP. The XP setup detects DOS and configures a boot menu at startup.
